results.title: Metal skin
results.creator_credit: Daniel Scharf, Daniel Scharf Productions, Southern Star Entertainment and Geoffrey Wright
results.brief_description: After the controversial success of “Romper Stomper”, Geoffrey Wright’s second feature was a critical and commercial failure. However, this story about four young teenagers who find their only joy and exhileration in drag racing, is a mesmerising study of contemporary working class alienation. Set in Melbourne’s western suburbs the film is a hyper-kinetic study of the fractures and tensions at play in Australian society. The young cast is excellent as is the editing and cinematography.

results.title: Metal of the centuries
results.brief_description: Documentary showing the uses of coper, brass, and bronze throughout history and across continents and the processing of copper from ore to its various finished forms such as copper alloys. Also shows the various industries that used the metal such as brewing and the motor and shipping industries.

results.title: Metal in harmony
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Kenneth J. Fairbairn
results.brief_description: Illustrates how aluminium is created, and indicates how much the metal is needed in the modern world. The basic raw material is mined in Ghana then shipped to Scotland, were hydro-electric power is available to create aluminium - a metal which is a skilful blend of ingredients.

results.title: Metal cutting tools: rake and clearance angles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
A demonstration of the correct usage of cutting tools. Angles required for clearance to avoid rubbing, chatter and vibration are shown in detail. Rake angles used for drilling different types of metals are also demonstrated.

results.title: Metal craft
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A craftsman at work making a pewter bowl by spinning and shaping a blank for later soldering to a cast base; and a bronze bowls by raising, smoothing, annealing, planishing, and burnishing a blank disc. Methods of constructing a candlestick mould, inserting the core, pouring, removing, and finishing the pewter cast are demonstrated. The designing, chasing, shaping and soldering of the sides and top of a jewel-box are also demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Metadata
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, ONF | NFB and Peter Foldes
results.brief_description: A new direction in the art of film animation-using a computer to assist the animator. In this film, it was the computer of the National Research Council of Canada that performed most of the work of animation, registering the hundreds of movements to produce a fluid, evolving effect. Without the computer, each movement or impression would have had to be painstakingly arranged by hand. The theme of the film is our universal desire to escape the demands of life. A film without words. Music by A. Clavier. (Awards: Oberhausen)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierre Moretti, ONF | NFB and Peter Foldes

results.title: MET Gala Review: Chaotic Australian Edition
results.brief_description: Australian comedian Samantha Andrew takes to her Instagram account to review several of the red carpet looks at this year’s MET Gala. The 2022 “Gilded Glamour, White Tie” theme inspired Samantha Andrew to make rapid-fire comparisons to iconic Australian celebrities, experiences and objects.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Australian comedian Samantha Andrew takes to her Instagram account to review several of the red carpet looks at this year’s MET Gala. The 2022 “Gilded Glamour, White Tie” theme inspired Andrews to make rapid-fire comparisons to iconic Australian celebrities, experiences and objects.
description_for_label: Australian comedian Samantha Andrew takes to her Instagram account to review several of the red carpet looks at this year’s MET Gala. details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → MM-09. Catch of the Day

results.title: Messieurs les Ronds de Cuir = The Pencil Pushers (TV Version)
results.brief_description:
This adaptation of Courteline revolves around a group of public servants working in a Ministry. Boring routine, mental inflexibility, narrowmindness: all the low points of human nature in general, and public administration in particular are being finely observed and satirised.

Credits: Director, writer, Daniel Ceccaldi ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Raymond Pellegrin, Daniel Ceccaldi, Evelyne Buyle, Roger Carel, Raymond Armontel, Bernard Lecoq, Claude Dauphin.
